Cf., Great Temple (Bestock 1999, Fig. 12) but larger diameter; Ez Zantur (Schmid 1995, Fig. 3, 17) dated to Phase 3, and 663; North Ridge Tomb 2 (Bikai 2001, Fig. 8, 1), second half of CE first century.

Ring base is flattened angularly on exterior. White slip band, approximately 2.5 cm wide, on exterior upper body. Rim Exterior fabric color 5YR7/6 reddish yellow. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94. Cf., Oboda (Negev 1986, 563) Middle Nabataean, Southern Retaining Wall; Pella (Hendrix et al., 1996, 283).

E32E0514-02EA-4C55-0AF1-9DDA269E995F.person: Martha Sharp Joukowsky, Shari L. Saunders

E32E0514-02EA-4C55-0AF1-9DDA269E995F.Description: 2. Funnel neck. Diam. 1.8 cm. Thickness: 3 mm. Light red 2.5YR 6/6 ware. Plain vertical rim. White slip covers exterior in pinkish white 7.5YR 8/2 slip. Many small and medium sized lime inclusions on surface. Diagonal lines on exterior. Neck is warped. This is the longest spout in the assemblage. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94. Cf., North Ridge Tomb 2 (personal communication with Bikai) which also has areas of white slip.

Thick encrustation on interior and exterior. This is the shortest spout in the assemblage. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94. Cf., North Ridge Tomb 2 (personal communication with Bikai) which also has areas of white slip.

Red 2.5YR 5/6 slip on exterior to mid-body and over rim to interior of neck. Two palmette wreaths with line of tadpoles between and vertical commas on neck in dark reddish gray 2.5YR 4/. Handle is not attached perpendicular to rim. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94. Cf., North Ridge Tomb 2 (Bikai 2001, Fig. 9, 17), dating to second half of CE first century.

B6EDFD38-4E96-4E8B-BE93-7E621BBCE076.person: Martha Sharp Joukowsky, Shari L. Saunders

B6EDFD38-4E96-4E8B-BE93-7E621BBCE076.Description: 26. Jug. Diam. 4.8 cm. Thickness: 3 mm. Fine light red 2.5YR 6/8 ware. Exterior color: light red 10R 6/8. Three broad bands of vertical rouletting. In some areas the 2 mm long rouletted lines converge so well to create single lines. Lower band appears to have been created with 6 mm wide wheel design. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94. Cf., Petra Church (Gerber 2001a, Fig. 1, 17); Khairy (1982, Fig. 75) lists early comparanda; Hendrix 1996, 357, late Roman but slimmer lower body.

E3EC4F6C-B683-4C26-5AC9-04F798F614E5.person: Martha Sharp Joukowsky, Shari L. Saunders
E3EC4F6C-B683-4C26-5AC9-04F798F614E5.label: Pottery 74
E3EC4F6C-B683-4C26-5AC9-04F798F614E5.Description: 23. Jug. Diam. 4.5-4.8 cm. Thickness: 2-3 mm. Light gray 5YR 7/1 ware. Exterior fabric color: pink 5YR8/4. Interior fabric color: gray 5YR6/1. Sloppily applied light reddish brown 2.5YR 6/4 slip on exterior and over rim top. Simple rouletting in 3 bands. Vertical strokes are 2 mm in length. Upper band composed of 7 lines and arranged to be offset from one another.  Lower band of rouletting composed of 4 lines of 2 mm long vertical strokes. Rows are offset from one another. Appears to be one roller. Middle band of 5 lines is so uneven in one place that it appears that the roller was moved across the vessel 4 times. One side of body is punched inwards slightly. Carination line on lower body where base attaches is not straight; perhaps created by shaving. Location: UT, Residential Quarter, Trench 94.
